channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Multiple potholes where previous repairs breaking down, 3rd October
item.description:
A40 between Arle Court hub and M5 turn off. Multiple pot holes increasing in size around edges of previous repairs which are now breaking apart
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): A40, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Two drain holes totally blocked as per photo, 3rd October
item.description:
Drain totally full and water then comes down road next to hall and causes damage on property st end . This needs to be cleared last time reported no action taken now the drains are totally blocked . Drains on edge of road near farm gate to field . Opposite Dower House .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sevenhampton, Cotswold

item.title: The trees and hedge have grown up so considerably that it is blocking light to our garden and makes it unbearable to enjoy are garden any time of the year . If it’s not debris fallen it’s the sap or seedlings ., 2nd October
item.description:
Back boundary to our rear garden. On windy ridge road council area by pylon It has been an issue for a couple of years we were hoping that maintenance would be done to them as I think it has been over ten years since the hedge was cut last .but nothing has been done about the trees ever we have been here for 20 years .

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Stanwick Crescent, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole in the road, wide and quite deep., 2nd October
item.description:
The bigger pothole is located on the road in front of number 8 and number 9. However, there are pot holes all over Ansell Close, I know they are tarmacking Caernarvon road, can it be possible to get the Ansell close done. There are multiple pot holes all bigger than dinner plates. Road is in such poor condition now. Its ruining our cars and makes the road look ugly and run down.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 8, Ansell Close, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vegetation blocking an already narrow pavement next to a very busying fast road, 2nd October
item.description:
The B4632 between Cleeve Hill and Winchcombe, opposite Cockbury Court. I was walking along Langley Road from Winchcombe to Dryfield, but the road is flooded so I took a footpath towards Rushbury House then turned left towards Cockbury Court. I then needed to walk down the road towards Dryfield. It was very dangerous as there was only about 30cm of pavement, with overhanging vegetation as well and lorries were going down the hill at speed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4632, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A large 52 inch x 25 inch pothole in the middle of a larger indentation in the road outside numbers 41 and 43 Ryeworth Road, 2nd October
item.description:
When it rains a very large puddle forms that passing traffic then splashes on pedestrians and the houses and cars alongside.The grit and pebbles in the in the water is starting to cause damage. It is difficult for passing traffic to avoid the pothole and water because of the proximity of parked cars opposite. This problem has existed for at least 3 years but has recently become worse.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 41, Ryeworth Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 328, Hatherley Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Pothole filled in the past few days on Finlay way has immediately sunk, 2nd October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Cheltenham
